name: Inventory
title: Inventory
text:
You have 7 inventory slots now. In exchange, the part of the interface is gone.
Attack, Accuracy, Avoid, etc. can instead be checked in the small window on the map.

name: Holdable Accs.
title: Holdable Accessories
text:
Similar to Thracia 776, there are accessories that give bonuses just by being in the unit's inventory. They will be marked in the description as holdable.{br}
These accessories usually have a slight negative effect as well as the positive. The only limit to how many holdable accessories one unit can carry is their inventory space.

name: Equip Accs.
title: Equippable Accessories
text: Some accessories that give skills, bonus stats, and/or affect growths may instead be equippable. A unit can only have one Equippable accessory at a time, on an exclusive inventory slot.

name: Monster Wep.
title: Monster Weapons
text:
Instead of being items, monster weapons have their own weapon rank.
+3/-3 Damage given taken, +25 Hit, +10 Avoid for every rank at S rank and above.

name: Durability
title: Durability
text: This time you don't have to worry about durability. Instead, some weapons have a cooldown system, which makes them unusable for a few turns. Myrrh won't be at risk of losing her Dragonstone.

name: Elements
title: Elements
text:
Magic and some physical weapons have elements associated with them. They can cause statuses and/or deal super effective damage.
The elements are:{br}<icon>Light</> Light{br}<icon>Dark</> Dark{br}<icon>Water</> Water{br}<icon>Ice</> Ice
<icon>Fire</> Fire{br}<icon>Thunder</> Thunder{br}<icon>Wind</> Wind{br}<icon>Earth</> Earth
Some weapons have multiple elements.{br}If a weapon has an element (or more) associated, the description will indicate it.

name: Effectiveness
title: Effectiveness
text:
There are more types of effectiveness in FE8R. We have effectiveness of unit type and effectiveness of status.
Unit type:{br}<icon>Horse</>Horse{br}<icon>Armor</> Armor{br}<icon>Flying</> Flying{br}<icon>Infantry</> Infantry
<icon>Sword</> Sword{br}<icon>Magic</> Magic{br}<icon>Pirate</> Pirate{br}<icon>Dragon</> Dragon{br}<icon>Monster</> Monster
Status:{br}1. <icon>Drenched</> Drenched{br}2. <icon> Seared</> Seared{br}3. <icon> Shadowblight</>Shadowblight{br}4. <icon>Frozen</> Frozen{br}5. <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures.
Of course, this means that elemental weapons can be more dangerous.{br}
Effective damage deals +5 DMG and x3 Damage Multiplier. Very Effective deals +32 DMG and x3 Damage Multiplier.

name: Elemental Combos
title: Elemental Combos
text:
Using a certain element or Heavy weapon while a unit is inflicted with a certain element will create an elemental combo and deal Effective Damage.{br}
Combos (<icon>Wind</> after <icon>Fire</>, <icon>Thunder</> after <icon>Water</>, <icon>LightA</> after <icon>DarkA</>, <red>Heavy</> after <icon>Ice</>){br}

name: Heavy Wep.
title: Heavy Weapons

name: Staves
title: Staves

name: Bows
title: Bows
text: Bows have better range than in the original. Most bows now have 2-3 range. Bows are also effective against Anima, Light, and Dark magic, on addition to Flying enemies.

name: Damage Form.
title: Damage Formulas
text:
Some weapons use stats that aren't just Strength and Defense (for physical weapons) or Magic and Resistance (for magical weapons).
If a weapon has one of these different damage formulas, it will be noted on the description, if two or more stats are used to calculate Attack, the value will be shown as well (before adding Might).

name: Extra Effects
title: Extra Effects
text: Some weapons have special properties besides the typical ones for their type. These properties include skills, combat arts, status effects, stats improvement and even water walking.

name: Multi Wep.
title: Multi Weapons
text: Some items (primarily character Arsenals) that contain more than one weapon. These weapons can't be stolen.

name: Other Changes
title: Other Changes

name: Bosses
title: Bosses
text:
From chapter 5 onwards, bosses will have an ability that revives them a set amount of times (like in Fire Emblem Engage).{br}
They will also, typically, wield weapons that can counter attack at any range and cannot be stolen.

name: Minibosses
title: Minibosses
text: Starting in chapter 3, there will be minibosses that drop weapons. They may also have Revival Stones.

name: Wep. Triangle
title: Weapon Triangle

name: Weather
title: Weather
text: Some unit's may be able to summon weather effects such as sandstorms through certain weapon skills. They stack with each other freely, and only affect enemies.

name: Growths
title: Growths

name: Pair Up
title: Pair Up
text:
This game features Pair Up and Dual Strikes as they function in Fates, only without stat bonuses for pairing up supported units.
The higher tier a unit is, the higher the bonus that unit gives when paired up will be. The total bonus depends on the unit's current and past classes.
This means that two characters with a different base class will retain that differing pair up even if they promote into the same class.
The type of Pair Up bonuses are the following (if two bonuses are listed together it's because they count as the same):  
Lord/Manakete{br}Knight{br}Cavalier{br}Pegasus{br}Priest/Cleric
Fighter{br}Pirate{br}Archer/Thief{br}Monk/Dancer{br}Mage
Myrmidon{br}Mercenary{br}Wyvern{br}Shaman
Priest/Cleric Pair Up makes lead unit inmune to negative status and heals a bit of health at the start of the turn.

name: Defense Gauge
title: Defense Gauge
text:
While paired up, the Guard Gauge increases by 2 every time your unit attacks or is attacked (missing counts for this).
When the meter reaches 10, the next attack from the enemy will be blocked.

name: Affinity Strike
title: Affinity Strike
text:
When two units are Paired Up, they can use a combat art named Affinity Strike. 
If the unit kills the enemy, it gains Galeforce, but stats are reduced by 90% for a turn.
Additionally, they inflict a status that depends on the Pair Up partner's affinity.
Enemies can be paired up too. Though they cannot Affinity Strike, and instead gain a 50% damage increase.
Affinity Strike's status effects are, by affinity:{br}
1. <icon>Fire</> -> Seared{br}2. <icon>Wind</> -> Breached(8){br}3. <icon>Thunder</> -> Stunned
4. <icon>Dark</> -> Cursed/Shadowblight{br}5. <icon>Light</> -> Reduced Vision{br}6. <icon>Ice</> -> Frozen{br}
7. <icon>Anima</> -> (has a 50% chance of inflicting each of Seared, Drenched, Cursed/Shadowblight, Frozen and Rock Punctures)

name: Bonus EXP
title: Bonus Experience
text:
Bonus Experience (BEXP) is a mechanic that allows you to give experience to your units outside of battle with the cost increasing with your unit's level and tier.
Certain actions like visiting villages or houses (even those that give you no items) can give you more BEXP.
Clearing a map before a turn limit will give you more BEXP. Clearing a level of the Tower of Valni or the Lagdou Ruins also gives BEXP.

name: RNG Method
title: RNG Method
text:
In Hard and Lunatic mode, there are options of 1RN and 2RN. They correspond to the type of RN (Random Number) system used in hit rate.
1RN: Used in FE1-5. No modifications. A 70% displayed chance to hit is exactly a 70% real chance to hit.
2RN: Used in FE6-13. The engine generates two random numbers and averages them. 
This makes displayed chances to hit above 50% more likely than expected, and those lower than 50% less likely than expected. A 70% displayed chance to hit is actually 82.3%.

name: Growth Method
title: Growth Method
text:
When you start a new game, you'll be asked to choose a growth method.
Random: Truly random growths. For each stat, a random number is rolled between 0 and 99. If the number is less than the growth rate, that stat increases.
Fixed: Units will always have their average stats. A unit with a 50% growth rate is guaranteed to get a stat increase every other level.
Dynamic: Like Random, but it applies a rubberbanding effect to the growth rate. If a unit fails to increase a stat on level-up, next level-up that stat will have a higher effective growth rate.
All methods result in the unit having the same average stat as they level up. 
For instance, a level 1 unit that starts with a Speed stat of 5 and a speed growth of 40, under all three methods, will end up with, on average, a Speed stat of 13 at level 20. 
The only difference is how wide the variance on the results will be, with the Fixed method having no variance, and the Dynamic method having reduced variance compared to the Random method.

name: The Lords
title: The Lords
text:
Both Eirika and Ephraim will have access to the convoy regardless of which route you chose.
Eirika and Ephraim's classes have higher stat caps than other classes from the same tier.
The Lord of the route you didn't choose will return as a Tier 3 unit in chapter 15.

name: Paragon
title: Paragon
text: Your trainees and Myrrh have the Paragon skill (makes the unit gain double Experience) when they join. They will lose it upon promoting.

name: Trainees
title: Trainees
text:
Your classic trainees have a special ability that increases their crit chance by their internal level.
Your trainees also have three T1 promotions.{br}Ross can promote to Fighter, Pirate or Barbarian.
Amelia can promote to Knight, Soldier or Wyvern Rider.{br}Ewan can promote to Mage, Shaman or Monk.

name: Other Trainees
title: Other Trainees
text:
You have the option to have Franz, Neimi and Natasha join as a trainees instead of their usual classes. They'll have some special promotions if they start as a trainee.
Their T1 classes options are:{br}Franz: Sword Cavalier, Knight and Mercenary.{br}Neimi: Archer, Outlaw and Kyudoka.{br}Natasha: Cleric, Troubadour and Medic.

name: Joining Level
title: Joining Level
text:
With the exceptions of Amelia, Ewan and Myrrh, units now come at a more reasonable level making easier to use them.
Some will promote when you get them or before the map starts. Beginning with chapter 10, units will begin at T2. At chapter 14, they'll be T3.

name: Hard Mode BNS
title: Hard Mode Bonuses
text: Like in FE6 and FE7, units that start as enemies are stronger in Hard, Lunatic and Aria mode.

name: Proficiencies
title: Proficiencies
text:
Each unit has an arsenal with their Prf weapons. Your units will unlock and in some cases replace their weapons when they get enough Weapon Experience. 
Some units will replace their Prf weapons after an event.
Some units have new dialog in their joining chapter that indicates their proficiencies, in red text, so you can notice it more easily.
Your units' arsenals' description includes icons with their proficiencies, which gives a hint of what they can use on some promotions. 
Keep in mind that some units can't promote to classes that let them use the full arsenal.
Just because two units' arsenals have the same weapon types it doesn't mean that they'll play the same. Their Prf weapons can have different effects/properties.

name: Seth Hints
title: Seth Hints
text:
Seth starts weaker than in the official games. Luckily, he can regain his strength on two ocassions:
His C support with Eirika. {br}A base conversation in chapter 9 (this conversation requires you to keep a certain healer alive).
Both of these events will give Seth stats and increase his growths.

name: Orson
title: Orson
text: Orson's items are exclusive to him and cannot be traded.

name: New Units
title: New Units
text: There are many more units available to the player than in vanilla FE8, inlcuding community made units, found in the Dragon's Gate.

name: Playable Mons.
title: Playable Monsters
text:
You can get your own monsters. They're optional and you can obtain them after beating certain maps, with the exception of one pair which joins in a base conversation. They have their own arsenal.
If Lute and/or Knoll are alive, they can revive your fallen monsters after falling in combat even in classic mode.
Your Gorgon starts as a T2 and she counts as being a promoted Shaman. Your Cyclops also starts as a T2 and is considered a promoted Fighter.
Monsters only get promotion choices for T3 classes.{br}There's a new Monster line: the Tarvadour, a support class that is a horse type.

name: My Unit
title: My Unit
text:
You have the option of creating your Avatar. After chapter 1, a new location will appear in the world map.
When creating the optional MyUnit, you'll have to choose a Boon (strong point), Bane (weak point) and a starting class (only excludes Lord classes) that includes monster classes.
At levels 5 and 15 of each tier, MyUnit will gain another skill from a list of 10 skills that belong to a class from the same tier.

name: Free Actions
title: Free Actions
text: Unlike the original game, certain actions won't end your turn. Support conversations, Talk and using consumable healing items are free actions.

name: Supports
title: Supports

name: Tiers
title: Tiers
text: Your units can go up to Tier 3, like in FE10. T3 classes have a level cap of 30.

name: Promotions
title: Promotions
text:
When you're in the promotion screen, you can see the weapons that each class uses and the skills it learns.
Both the Dancer and Manakete classes are T2 classes, which means that they only promote once.
T1 and T2 units promote automatically after their level cap, but they can promote earlier if you use a Master Seal at level 15 or later. 
The Master Seal won't be consumed after being used.
In general, promotions are made so that you don't discard weapons, but there are some exceptions.

name: Skills
title: Skills
text:
All classes learn skills by leveling up. Skills are learned at levels 5 and 15.
Some classes have level 1 skills like Canto or Steal.

name: Thieves
title: Thieves
text:
Stealing and opening locks is a bit different here.{br}You don't need lockpicks to open chests/doors.{br}You can steal enemy's unequipped weapons.
There are certain weapons that you can't steal to prevent cheesing certain enemies.
You can steal with a full inventory and they will ask you what item you want to send to the convoy.
Thief units that have sword rank can use daggers.
Daggers are in general 1-2 range weapons, so your sword locked thieves have better range than in the original game.
Units that have thief skills will retain those skills even if they promote to classes that aren't thief classes.
You don't have to worry about choosing promotions for your thieves on fear that they would lose those skills.

name: Ballistas
title: Ballistas
text:
Ballistas are regular classes instead of features of certain maps.
Your archers can promote into them, and will receive a ballista item upon promotion.

name: Cavaliers
title: Cavaliers
text:
Cavaliers can only use one weapon type. Due to branch promotions that can vary depending on the unit.
Your cavaliers can end up wielding different weapons even if they start with the same weapon.

name: Class Changes
title: Class Changes
text:
Some classes, for the purpose of effective damage, had their class type change (or added in some cases). 
In the early game, you may find that Mogalls count as flyers and that spiders count as Horses. This applies to their promotions too.
Mogalls can use their personal Light Magic.{br}The Manakete class has a level cap of 30 instead of 20 like the other classes. 
Mage Knights use Anima Magic and Swords instead of Anima Magic and Staves, and is no longer a promotion option for Troubadour.
Your Paladins can use Light Magic.{br}Knights can use more than one weapon type.{br}Wyvern Lords have Axes instead of swords.
Eirika's Great Lord class can use both combat and support Staves.{br}Ewan's promotions are special in the sense that he can keep Anima magic after promotion.
The dancer class counts as a promotion of Monk (Tethys already comes with T1 Monk skills).

name: Base
title: Base
text:
Before a chapter's battle preparations, there's a base like in FE9 and FE10. 
In the base you can give BEXP to your units, see base conversations, and activate support conversations. 
When you select Continue, you'll be sent to the battle preparations screen.

name: Turnwheel
title: The Turnwheel
text: The Turnwheel (a mechanic that was introduced in FE15) allows you to rewind to a previous point in a map. You have 7 charges that reset after a map.

name: Residual Dmg
title: Residual Damage
text:
In this game, poison is potentially more lethal and has been renamed to venom. <icon>Venom</> Venom can stack, so the HP loss at the start of the turn can be deadly. 
There's also the bleeding<icon>Bleed</> status, that makes you lose HP at the start of the turn and lose speed and it stacks.
These statuses cannot, however, deal lethal damage to player units or bosses.

name: Arena
title: Arena
text: You can no longer farm EXP and money in the arena. Instead, you'll be able to battle a miniboss that drops a weapon upon being defeated.

name: Shops
title: Shops
text:
Armories and vendors have a wider variety of items, instead of regular steel, silver, etc. weapons.
You can enter secret shops during the main campaign from the overworld. You don't have to worry about missing out because you skipped a Secret Shop during its chapter.

name: Discount
title: Discount
text: The bad news is that the Silver Card doesn't exist here. The good news is that there are a few classes that learn a skill that reduces the shop prices.

name: Post Battle
title: Post Battle
text:
Taken from Engage, this mechanic allows you to interact with the map after clearing a map. You can do the following:
Train with an ally. You can talk to an ally unit and raise a stat that you want for both your Lord and that unit.
You can train up to 4 times for chapter.{br}Talk with NPCs. You can talk with NPCs placed outside their houses that will give you BEXP.
(You can also visit villages or houses you didn't during the battle, though doing this will result in less overall BEXP)
Other interactions. If you see a shiny spark, and interact with it, it can produce events that can include small reinforcements.

name: Tower/Ruins
title: Tower and Ruins
text:
If you cleared a level of the Tower or the Ruins, when you return you'll be given the option to skip that level.
You won't have to go through weak enemies when you want to grind in the Tower.{br}Clearing later levels of the Ruins will give you random weapons.
The Ruins aren't only populated by monsters now. There are human enemies there too. This means that Slayer can't solve all your problems there.
Both the Tower and the Ruins are now randomized. Enemy placements, classes, and inventory may vary. Enemies can also drop stat boosters and accessories.

name: Eirika
title: Eirika
text:
The princess of the Kingdom of Renais. She's elegant and kind.
Eirika's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Sword</><icon>Light</><icon>Dark</><icon>Anima</>
<icon>Sword</>: A rapier that has <icon>Thunder</> Thunder affinity and always strikes first. Evolves into the legendary weapon after Chapter 16 and gains monster effectiveness.{br}Magic at a distance.
<icon>Light</>: A tome that reduces the damage nearby allies take and makes them heal a part of their HP at the start of the turn.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that inflicts <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight and is effective against <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted enemies.
<icon>Anima</>: A tome that has Rapier effectiveness. Uses Str and Mag. It has the skill Flash Step, which swords usually have.

name: Seth
title: Seth
text:
A young commander of Renais. He's calm, composed, and skilled.
Seth's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Lance</><icon>Light</><icon>Sword</>
<icon>Lance</>: Ignores weapon triangle.{br}1st stage: A lance that drenches the enemy and ignores the Weapon Triangle. Has Mercy. 
Lords and Horse units deal more damage, receive less damage and have +5 Crit. Is replaced after a Base convo in Chapter 9.
2nd and 3rd stages: +3/-3 damage given/taken, +3 Crit for each ally within 3 spaces. Gains an extra attack for each 3 allies within 3 spaces.
<icon>Light</>: A light tome with these effects: +3/-3 damage given/taken, +3 Crit for each ally within 3 spaces. Gains an extra attack for each 3 allies within 3 spaces.
<icon>Sword</>: A <icon>Dark</> Dark elemental Sword that deal damage to the user on hit, and inflicts <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight on target. The damage taken also increases with the upgrades, but also comes with Ancient Pact.

name: Franz
title: Franz
text:
An earnest and compassionate cavalier from Renais. 
Franz's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Sword</><icon>Lance</><icon>Anima</>
<icon>Sword</>: A sword that also uses Magic for damage.{br}First stage gives extra WEXP.{br}Later stages target Res. All stages inflict <icon>Seared</> Seared and are effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses.
<icon>Lance</>: A lance that also uses Luck for damage, is effective against <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted enemies and deals Splash damage. Gets increased range in its final stage.
<icon>Anima</>: A 1-3 range reaver tome that also uses Luck for damage. It is effective against <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted enemies and deals fixed extra damage on Crits.

name: Gilliam
title: Gilliam
text:
An armored knight from Frelia. He's quiet yet dependable. 
Gilliam's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Lance</><icon>Sword</><icon>Bow</>
<icon>Lance</>: A heavy lance that uses Defense for damage, provokes enemies and can counter at a distance. Has <icon>Thunder</> Thunder affinity to start, and gains <icon>Dark</> Dark affinity later.
<icon>Sword</>: A blade that uses Skill for damage and is effective against <icon>Armor</> Armors. Has <icon>Wind</> Wind affinity to start, and gains <icon>Earth</> Earth affinity later.
<icon>Bow</>: A siege bow that is effective against Armor and Drenched enemies. Gets extra damage based on the difference in the enemy's Attack Speed compared to 1/3 of Gilliam's Attack Speed.

name: Vanessa
title: Vanessa
text:
A sincere, honest, and honourable pegasus knight of Frelia.
Vanessa's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Lance</><icon>Sword</><icon>Bow</>
<icon>Lance</>: A lance that is effective against <icon>Flying</> Flier and <icon>Seared</> Seared enemies. It uses Strength and Speed for damage and its range increases with certain upgrades.
<icon>Sword</>: A 2-3 range sword that is effective against <icon>Flying</> Flier and <icon>Seared</> Seared enemies. It uses Strength and Skill for damage and its range increases with certain upgrades.
<icon>Bow</>: A bow that inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared status and <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures. Also effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses. Uses Strength and Resistance for damage. Its range is 4-5.
<icon>Staff</>: A staff that heals in a plus shape. Healing scales off of MAG and LCK. Size increases upon evolution.

name: Moulder
title: Moulder
text:
A mature priest of Frelia. He's gentle and reassuring.
Moulder's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Staff</><icon>Light</><icon>Axe</>
<icon>Staff</>: A staff that uses Strength and Defense instead of Magic. It inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures. After reaching its second stage, it raises Moulder's Defense. 
After reaching its third stage, if Moulder's Strength is higher or equal than enemy's Strength, he gets an extra attack.
<icon>Light</>: A tome that uses Strength and Luck instead of Magic and inflicts <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight.
<icon>Axe</>: An axe that is effective against <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted, <icon>Armor</> Armor and <icon>Drenched</> Drenched enemies. Uses Strength and Resistance for damage.

name: Ross
title: Ross
text:
A young villager. He longs to be a warrior, like his father.
Ross's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Axe</><icon>Dark</><icon>Bow</><icon>Monster</>
<icon>Axe</>: A 1-2 range axe that gives a bonus attack and is effective against <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted enemies. Uses Strength and Skill for damage upon the third evolution. Its fourth version becomes Brave.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that is also effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses and inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared. Costs HP to use, with the cost increasing with each upgrade.
<icon>Bow</>: A bow that is also effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses and inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared on the enemy. It has a Torch effect.
In its last form, it has the following effect: Gets 5 extra attacks, but takes 70 damage after combat and enemy gets -40 for 3 turns.
<icon>Monster</>: On its first form, it gives more Wexp. On later forms, it's a magical breath that is effective against <icon>Magic</> Magic and <icon>Monster</> Monster enemies and Silences enemies. It recovers part of damage dealt.

name: Garcia
title: Garcia
text:
A villager from Renais. He was once a feared military leader.
Garcia's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Axe</><icon>Sword</><icon>Bow</>
<icon>Axe</>: An axe that inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared and <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight upon the enemy. After the first version, it gets a blast version and a normal version for attacking. Also uses Constitution for damage.
<icon>Sword</>: A heavy weapon that inflicts Curse and <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight on the enemy. Increases Strength when hit by an enemy up to 5 times. From its third version onwards, it confuses on the enemy.
On its last version, it halves Speed, but doubles Defense and Resistance. It also uses HP for damage.
<icon>Bow</>: A bow whose use is a free action but has a cooldown, inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures.

name: Neimi
title: Neimi
text:
A childhood friend of Colm who hails from Renais. She cries a lot.
Neimi's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Bow</><icon>Sword</><icon>Light</><icon>Lance</>
<icon>Bow</>: A bow that uses Magic and Skill for damage, inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared and is effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses.
<icon>Sword</>: A magical <icon>Earth</> Earth element sword that raises Neimi's DEF and RES and reduces her damage taken on enemy phase. Uses Magic and Resistance for damage.
<icon>Light</>: A 1 Range <icon>Fire</> Fire element tome that uses Skill for damage, is effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses, deals splsh damage and cannot be countered.
<icon>Lance</>: <icon>Light</> Light and <icon>Wind</> Wind lance with a cleave effect that shoves enemies. It uses Luck and Speed for damage, and gains <icon>Fire</> Fire element on its third version.

name: Colm
title: Colm
text:
A childhood friend of Neimi who hails from Renais. He can be snide.
Colm's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Sword</><icon>Bow</><icon>Axe</>
<icon>Sword</>: 1. Starts as a Dagger that lowers enemy accuracy and is effective against <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted enemies, later on it gains a version that can Multi-Target, but not Dual Strike.
2. A Dagger that swaps the unit with the target after combat, and its final version applies 3 stacks of both <icon>Venom</> Venom and <icon>Bleed</> Bleed.
<icon>Bow</>: A 4-6 range Bow that raises Avoid and Speed, eventually it applies <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight and Curse. Uses SKL and SPD for damage.
<icon>Axe</>: An axe that uses Strength and Speed and inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures and <icon>Venom</> Venom, the amount of stacks increases with upgrades. It starts with 1-3 range and its last form has 1-4 range.

name: Artur
title: Artur
text:
A young monk from Renais. He is a very forthright and pious man.
Artur's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Light</><icon>Staff</><icon>Lance</>
<icon>Light</>: A tome that is also effective against <icon>Pirate</> Pirates and inflicts the <icon>Frozen</> Frozen status. Uses Magic and Resistance for damage on second evolution. Its final version is also effective against <icon>Monster</> Monsters and inflicts Reduced Vision. Deals full damage in dual strikes.
<icon>Staff</>: A 1-4 range staff that <icon>Drenched</> Drenches enemies, later gains <icon>Wind</> Wind element, more range, and shoves enemies. Uses Luck and Skill for damage.
<icon>Lance</>: A lance that deals extra damage and receives less damage based on Artur's luck. In the final form, it gets extra attacks based on Artur's luck.

name: Lute
title: Lute
text:
A young mage of Renais. She believes she is a prodigy.
Lute's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Anima</><icon>Dark</><icon>Sword</>
<icon>Anima</>: 1. A tome that makes monsters more likely to attack Lute and deals more damage against them. Multiplies damage by 1.2 and +2 Mag/Skill for each stack.
2. (Unlocked at higher rank): A Luna tome that is effective against <icon>Flying</> Flying enemies and <icon>Seared</> Seared enemies. Has a cooldown.
<icon>Dark</>: 1. A tome that makes non monsters more likely to attack Lute and deals more damage against them. Multiplies damage by 1.2 and +2 Mag/Skill for each stack.
2. (Unlocked at a higher rank): A siege tome. Has a cooldown.
<icon>Sword</>: A 1-2 range wind sword that shoves the enemy and also uses Magic for damage.

name: Natasha
title: Natasha
text:
A beautiful cleric from the Grado Empire. She's graceful and serious.
Natasha's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Staff</><icon>Light</><icon>Lance</><icon>Sword</>
<icon>Staff</>: An <icon>Ice</> Ice affinity staff that is effective against  <icon>Pirate</> Pirates and inflicts the <icon>Frozen</> Frozen. Can select more than one target, and later gains an AoE version.
<icon>Light</>: Tome that reduces damagess from monsters and dark magic. In its final form, nullifies damage from monsters and dark magic.
<icon>Lance</>: A lance that starts with 7 range, later changes to 8 range and also uses Luck for damage. Effective against <icon>Flying</> Flying, <icon>Seared</> Seared and <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted enemies.
<icon>Sword></>: Dagger that uses Skill until the third evolution then uses Skill and Strength, and targets Speed.
Starting from its second version, it inflicts Anesthesia (reduces Skill and Speed up to 10 stacks). From the third version it will deal extra damage on sequential Critical Hits. Its fifth version inflicts 3 stacks of Bleed and Anesthesia, has 1-3 range and access to Mercy.

name: Joshua
title: Joshua
text:
A wandering sword fighter from Jehanna. He loves to gamble.{br}{br}Gains two powerful weapons at X rank <icon>Sword</> Swords.
Joshua's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Sword</><icon>Lance</><icon>Axe</>
<icon>Sword</>: 1. A sword that is effective against <icon>Flying</> Flying and <icon>Seared</> Seared units and uses Speed instead of Attack for damage until the second evolution which starts using Speed and Resistance. Range increases in later versions.
2. Sword that is effective against <icon>Magic</> Magic units and also uses Luck for damage. Has a 50/50 chance of either unit getting another attack, or the enemy getting another attack. On later versions, the chance is 75/25.
<icon>Lance</>: An <icon>Earth</> Earth lance that raises Defense and Resistance. Also uses Skill for damage. From its second version onwards, it becomes effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses and inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared on the enemy
<icon>Axe</>: An Axe that causes <icon>Bleed</> Bleeding and also uses Speed for damage. From its second version onwards, it inflicts <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight and Curse on the enemy.

name: Ephraim
title: Ephraim
text:
The prince of Renais. He is a man of great honor and bravery.
Ephraim's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Lance</><icon>Sword</><icon>Axe</>
<icon>Lance</>: It has the following skills:{br}Increases damage to all attacks and allies within 3 spaces get a skill that makes them follow up before the enemy if their HP is under 75%.
From its second version onwards, it gets a skill that gives allies in a 3 spaces range +10 Attack Speed
Evolves into the legendary weapon after Chapter 16 and gains monster effectiveness.
<icon>Sword</>: A sword that is effective against magic units and raises Resistance. Uses Strength and Resistance for damage.
<icon>Axe</>: A 3 range axe that is effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses and inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared.

name: Forde
title: Forde
text:
A cavalier from Renais. He is skilled, but reckless. He's Franz's brother.
Forde's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Sword</><icon>Lance</><icon>Dark</>
<icon>Sword</>: A sword with a combat art that turns enemies into green units. Also uses Skill for damage. 
Enemies that are transformed thanks to this sword will give Forde experience after engaging in combat.
<icon>Lance</>: A lance that is effective against <icon>Infantry</> Infantry units, has a Cleave effect and also uses Skill for damage. The last version inflicts <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight and Curse.
<icon>Dark</>: A brave tome that is effective against <icon>Flying</> Fliers and <icon>Seared</> Seared enemies. It has a cooldown. Uses Magic and Speed for damage.

name: Kyle
title: Kyle
text:
A steadfast and honourable cavalier in sworn service to Renais.
Kyle's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Axe</><icon>Lance</><icon>Sword</>
<icon>Axe</>: A 1-2 range heavy axe that inflicts <icon>Frozen</> Frozen on the enemy. Uses Strength and HP for damage upon the third evolution.
<icon>Lance</>: A heavy lance that is also effective against <icon>Armor</> Armor and <icon>Horse</> Horse units. Can't be countered at full HP. Its last version is also effective against <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted enemies. Uses Strength and Con for damage.
<icon>Sword</>: An <icon>Earth</> Earth sword that deals extra damage on Crit. Last form inflicts <icon>Frozen</> Frozen on the enemy. Uses Defence and Skill for damage.

name: Tana
title: Tana
text:
A young lady of Frelia. She is both cheery and sociable.{br}{br}Gains a powerful weapon at X rank <icon>Lance</> Lances.
Tana's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Lance</><icon>Bow</><icon>Anima</>
<icon>Lance</>: A lance that <icon>Drenched</> Drenches the enemy and gives access to Tana's Stash. uses Magic and Resistance upon second evolution  Her stash contains food items that heal and give buffs as free actions.
<icon>Bow</>: A bow that uses Magic and Skill for damage, inflicts <icon>Frozen</> Frozen on the enemy and is effective against <icon>Seared</> Seared and <icon>Pirate</> Pirate enemies. Last version always hits.
<icon>Anima</>: A 3-6 range tome that is effective against <icon>Flying</> Fliers and <icon>Seared</> Seared enemies that can Confuse and move non-boss enemies. It has a cooldown.

name: Amelia
title: Amelia
text:
A young girl from a small village in Grado. She is honest and sincere.
Amelia's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Lance</><icon>Axe</><icon>Bow</>
<icon>Lance</>: A lance that can target up to 3 enemies. In the last version it can target up to 4 enemies and deals effective damage against <icon>Armor</> Armor and <icon>Drenched</> Drenched enemies.
<icon>Axe</>: An axe that also uses Magic for damage. Effective against <icon>Armor</> Armor and <icon>Drenched</> Drenched enemies. Has a version with cooldown that deals Area of Effect damage.
<icon>Light</>: A <icon>Earth</> Light magic that can target multiple enemies and inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures. With each upgrade, it can target more enemies.
<icon>Monster</>: On its first form, it gives more Wexp. Later it's a magical breath that is effective against <icon>Armor</> Armor and <icon>Drenched</> Drenched enemies, raises Speed and Stuns enemies. It can't be countered, but it can't counter.
Its second form also inflicts Curse and <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight and is also effective against <icon>Dragon</> Dragon enemies.
<red>This unit may lose access to Lances or Axes in certain promotion paths!</>

name: Innes
title: Innes
text:
The prince of Frelia. He's brash and arrogant, but good at heart.{br}{br}Gains a powerful weapon at X rank <icon>Bow</> Bows.
Innes' personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Bow</><icon>Lance</><icon>Sword</>
<icon>Bow</>: A Brave bow with a minimum of 6 range. At higher stages it never misses.
<icon>Lance</>: A 1-2 range lance that <icon>Drenched</> Drenches the enemy and also uses Magic for damage. In its last stage it also inflicts <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight and Curse.
<icon>Sword</>: A 1-5 range sword that hits all enemies in a line, is effective against <icon>Pirate</> Pirates and inflicts the <icon>Frozen</> Frozen on the enemy. Uses Strength and Speed for damage.
Gains extra attacks if Attack Speed is high enough compared to enemy's, but cannot double normally, or Dual Strike.

name: Gerik
title: Gerik
text:
A mercenary leader from Jehanna. He's better known as the Desert Tiger.
Gerik's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Sword</><icon>Axe</><icon>Lance</>
<icon>Sword</>: A Blade that increases Crit chance based on the party's money and gains money after dealing a critical hit.
From its fourth version onwards, it inflicts Rock Punctures and can summon a Sandstorm after enough kills.
Its last form is also effective against <icon>Dragon</> Dragons and <icon>Monster</> Monsters and has the following effect:{br}Halves damage taken, heals 20% at the start of the turn and negative statuses last 1 turn.
<icon>Axe</>: A 1-2 range axe that is effective against <icon>Armor</> Armor and <icon>Drenched</> Drenched enemies. Uses Strength and Move for damage and targets the weaker of Defence or Resistance.
<icon>Lance</>: A 1-2 range heavy <icon>Earth</> Earth lance that inflicts AOE <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures, and is effective against <icon>Seared</> Seared and <icon>Flying</> Flying enemies.

name: Tethys
title: Tethys
text:
A beautiful and charming dancer from Jehanna.
Tethys' personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Light</><icon>Monster</>
<icon>Light</>: A tome with a cooldown that allows Tethys to perform another action after using it. Uses Magic and Luck for damage.
<icon>Monster</>: Magical breath that inflicts <icon>Silence</> Silence on the enemy and is effective against <icon>Magic</> Magic and <icon>Silence</> Silenced enemies. Its final form is also effective against <icon>Dragon</> Dragon and <icon>Monster</> Monster enemies.

name: Marisa
title: Marisa
text:
An aloof sword fighter from Jehanna. She's known as the Crimson Flash.
Marisa's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Sword</><icon>Axe</><icon>Dark</>
<icon>Sword</>: 1. A sword that can summon a Snowstorm after enough kills. Uses Speed for damage, inflicts <icon>Frozen</> Frozen and is effective against <icon>Pirate</> Pirates. Uses Strength and Resistance for damage upon third evolution.
2. A poisoned Dagger with 1-3 range.{br}3. Unlocked at the highest weapon level. A 1-2 range sword that can select up to 6 enemies, and uses Speed for damage. Has a cooldown.
<icon>Axe</>: An axe that uses Skill for damage and inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures and Stun on the enemy.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that <icon>Drenched</> Drenches the enemy and also uses Skill for damage.

name: L'Arachel
title: L'Arachel
text:
A young woman from Rausten. She fights for justice and honour.{br}{br}Gains a powerful weapon at X rank <icon>Light</> Light, and a powerful healing staff at X rank <icon>Staff</> Staves.
L'Arachel's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Staff</><icon>Light</><icon>Dark</>
<icon>Staff</>: 1. A regular offensive staff that has an AoE version on a cooldown. Uses Magic and Luck for damage upon second evolution.
<icon>Light</>: A tome that makes Mounted tome users and Light magic users receive less damage, increased Avoid and extra attacks (1, later 2). Uses Luck and Magic for damage.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that is effective against <icon>Monster</> Monsters and has a Nosferatu effect. Uses Magic and Con for damage.

name: Dozla
title: Dozla
text:
A berserker from Rausten. He's a hearty man with a thirst for life.
Dozla's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Axe</><icon>Sword</><icon>Dark</><icon>Monster</>
<icon>Axe</>: A heavy axe that inflicts Stun, but can go first. It has a Skill that increases Crit damage and Hit for each ally within 2 spaces.
<icon>Sword</>: A sword that <icon>Drenched</> Drenches the enemy and is effective against <icon>Drenched</> Drenched and <icon>Armor</> Armor units. Can summon a Rainstorm after enough kills. Uses Strength and Move for damage and targets the weaker of Defence or Resistance.
Its final form increases the <icon>Drenched</> Drenching radius, ignores terrain and is effective against <icon>Pirate</> Pirates.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that <icon>Drenched</> Drenches the enemy and uses Luck and Strength for damage. Has a version, with cooldown, that hits all enemies, but cannot double or give wexp.
<icon>Monster</>: On its first form, it gives more Wexp. Later it becomes a breath that inflicts <icon>Drenched</> Drenched and <icon>Venom</> Venom on the enemy and is effective against <icon>Flying</> Flying and <icon>Seared</> Seared enemies.
Its last version is also effective against <icon>Infantry</> Infantry units.

name: Saleh
title: Saleh
text:
A sage from the village Caer Pelyn. He's Ewan's solemn, but kind, teacher.
Saleh's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Anima</><icon>Dark</><icon>Staff</>
<icon>Anima</>: A tome that puts enemies to sleep and is effective against <icon>Flying</> Flying and <icon>Seared</> Seared enemies.
After its second stage it gains a variant with a cooldown that deals area damage, but can't Dual Strike.
<icon>Dark</>: 1. A tome that is effective against Sleeping enemies. Can apply a debuff to all enemies after killing a sleeping enemy, then 5 others. Uses Magic and Con for damage.
2. A tome that is unlocked at X rank. It has one use per chapter. It can't crit, double or do Dual Strikes and hits all enemies on the map. It starts on cooldown.
<icon>Staff</>: A staff that poisons enemies. It's a free action with a cooldown. It starts with cooldown at max value. 
On its first stage, it can select up to 6 targets. It eventually gains a second version, on cooldown, that hits all enemies.{br}On its final version, it's brave and inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures.

name: Ewan
title: Ewan
text:
A sage-in-training from Jehanna. He reveres his teacher, Saleh.
Ewan's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Anima</><icon>Light</><icon>Dark</>
<icon>Anima</>: 1. A 1-2 range fire tome that uses Skill for damage, is effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses and inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared. Has a cooldown. Can select up to 3 targets.
2. An X rank spell that inflicts <icon>Drenched</> Drenched, <icon>Frozen</> Frozen, <icon>Seared</> Seared, <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight and Curse.
Effective against <icon>Monster</> Monster, <icon>Horse</> Horse, <icon>Armor</> Armor, <icon>Flying</> Flying, <icon>Drenched</> Drenched, <icon>Seared</> Seared, <icon>Pirate</> Pirate and <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted enemies.
<icon>Light</>: A 5-6 range spell that uses Luck for damage. Has a cooldown. Can select up to 3 targets.
<icon>Dark</>: A 3-4 range spell that uses Strength for damage. Has a cooldown. Can select up to 3 targets.

name: Cormag
title: Cormag
text:
A wyvern knight of Grado. A gentle man, but a ferocious warrior.
Cormag's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Axe</><icon>Lance</><icon>Dark</><icon>Monster</>
<icon>Axe</>: An axe that scales off of Strength and Con.
From the second version onwards, it also inflicts <icon>Drenched</> Drenched on the enemy, attacks become effective against <icon>Drenched</> Drenched and <icon>Seared</> Seared enemies and gets the following effect: +15 Crit and -40 avoid in player phase. -15 Crit + 40 avoid in enemy phase.
<icon>Lance</>: A 1-2 range lance that is effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses and inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared.
In its final form, it uses both Strength and Magic for damage and gains the following effect: when at full HP, gains +25 Hit/Avoid, else becomes Berserked, all attacks become brave and heals half of damage dealt. Uses Strength and Magic for damage.
Critical hits deal x5 damage and gains +15 Crit.{br}Loses 75% health at the start of the turn, but has Galeforce twice per turn.
<icon>Dark</>:A tome that also uses Skill for damage and inflicts <icon>Venom</> Venom upon the enemy. Has a version, on cooldown, that hits all enemies, but can't double or Dual Strike. Doesn't give exp.
<icon>Monster</>: On its first form, it gives more Wexp. Later, it becomes a breath that is effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses and inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared, Curse and <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight on the enemy. Its second version is also effective against <icon>Infantry</> Infantry enemies.

name: Rennac
title: Rennac
text:
A lazy, greedy, but exceptional fighter from the Republic of Carcino.
Rennac's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Sword</><icon>Anima</><icon>Dark</>
<icon>Sword</>: A dagger that uses Speed instead of Attack for damage and is magical at range. Eclipse effect. It inflicts <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight, Curse and <icon>Bleed</> Bleeding on the enemy.
In its last form, it halves enemy's Speed, Defense, and Resistance. It has a cooldown.
<icon>Anima</>: A tome that has a Luck% chance of giving money if Rennac kills the enemy. These are AOE attacks.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that inflicts <icon>Venom</> Venom on the enemy and can target more than one enemy, with each version increasing the number of enemies it can hit.

name: Duessel
title: Duessel
text:
A courageous general in Grado's army. He's better known as Obsidian.{br}{br}Gains a powerful weapon at X rank <icon>Axe</> Axes.
Duessel's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Axe</><icon>Lance</><icon>Sword</>
<icon>Axe</>: An axe that is super effective against <icon>Infantry</> Infantry units, uses Defense and Skill.
<icon>Lance</>: A lance that after reaching its 2nd stage gets the following effect: when Duessel's HP drop below 75%, his Strength, Speed, Skill and Defense increase by 50%.
When his health drops below 50%, all allies get the same effect.
<icon>Sword</>: A heavy sword that also uses Defense for damage. It makes enemies within 6 spaces more likely to attack Duessel while he's above 50% health. Boosts his defense for each combat fought.

name: Knoll
title: Knoll
text:
One of Grado's royal mages. He knows the riddle of the Dark Stone.{br}{br}Gains a powerful weapon at X rank <icon>Dark</> Dark.
Knoll's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Dark</><icon>Staff</><icon>Anima</>
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that increases Knoll's Hit, Avoid and Crit avoid based on the difference between the enemy's Luck and his Luck.
After killing an enemy with this spell, gains a skill that makes him take no damage in the next combat. Uses Magic and Skill for damage.
<icon>Staff</>: 1. A staff that lowers enemy's stats.{br}2. A staff that raises an ally's stats.
<icon>Anima</>: A spell that inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures. Greatly increases Luck and also raises his Strength, Magic, Skill, Speed, Defense and Resistance to a lesser extent.

name: Myrrh
title: Myrrh
text:
A young, pure-hearted girl from the Darkling Woods. She tends to be shy.
Myrrh does not have an arsenal, but gains a special breath depending on the class she promotes to.
Nova Breath: The most powerful dragon's fire.{br}Inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared. <red>Very effective:</> <icon>Horse</>Horses and <icon>Monster</> Monsters.
Abyss Breath: A powerful breath from the Abyss.{br}Inflicts: <icon>Silence</> Silence. <red>Effective</>: <icon>Magic</> Magic units and <icon>Monster</> Monsters. Is a magical weapon.
Fell Breath: A wicked breath that tarnishes all.{br}<icon>Dark</> Dark element. Inflicts: <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight and Curse (8). <red>Effective: </><icon>Monster</> Monsters.

name: Syrene
title: Syrene
text:
The dutiful commander of the 3rd battalion of Frelia's pegasus knights.
Syrene's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Lance</><icon>Sword</><icon>Anima</>
<icon>Lance</>: A 1-2 range lance that uses Resistance for damage and is effective against <icon>Pirate</> Pirates and boosts Flying allies' Movement and Hit.
<icon>Sword</>: A 1-3 range brave sword that is effective against <icon>Armor</> Armor and <icon>Drenched</> Drenched enemies. Uses Strength and Move for damage and targets the weaker of Defence or Resistance.
<icon>Anima</>: A tome that always hits, inflicts <icon>Drenched</> Drenched and <icon>Frozen</> Frozen on the enemy and is effective against <icon>Pirate</> Pirates. Has a cooldown. 
On its last version it's also effective against <icon>Armor</> Armor and <icon>Drenched</> Drenched units.

name: Hellhound
title: Hellhound
text:
A wolf that has been experimented on for human transformations. Prefers to be in wolf form.
Hellhound's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Monster</><icon>Light</><icon>Dark</>
<icon>Monster</>: A fang attack that starts using Speed for damage. It inflicts <icon>Bleed</> Bleeding, with higher versions inflicting more stacks.
From the second version onwards, it also inflicts Breach. Its final version uses both Strength and Speed for damage.
It has a skill that gives extra attack(s), raises avoid and provokes nearby enemies when under 75% HP, but deals recoil damage when above. 
<icon>Light</>: A tome that is also effective against <icon>Flying</> Flying enemies and inflicts Crippled on the enemy, reducing its movement for 3 turns. It has a Cleave effect and shoves the enemy. 
After reaching its second version, it gets extra accuracy and damage for each ally.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome whose use costs HP, with each upgrade requiring more HP.

name: Bael
title: Bael
text:
An orphaned Bael. She seems to be tame and shy. Loves having her fur scratched.
Bael's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Monster</><icon>Dark</><icon>Sword</><icon>Bow</>
<icon>Monster</>: A claw attack that inflicts Breach and Curse on the enemy and raises unit's Defense and Resistance.
After reaching the second version, uses DEF and RES for damage.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that makes enemies in 5 spaces more likely to attack this unit. Also reduces enemy's Speed and Mov for 2 turns.
<icon>Sword</>: A blade that recovers part of damage dealt and reduces enemy's Speed and Mov for 2 turns. After reaching the second stage, it also inflicts <icon>Bleed</> Bleeding on the enemy.
<icon>Bow</>: A siege bow that is also effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses. It has a cooldown. It reduces enemy's Speed and Mov for 2 turns. On its final version, it inflicts Area of Effect damage.

name: Revenant
title: Revenant
text:
A poor soul reanimated unto this husk. He still has the will to fight though.
Revenant's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Monster</><icon>Dark</><icon>Anima</><icon>Staff</>
<icon>Monster</>: A claw attack that inflicts <icon>Venom</> Venom on the enemy, with each version inflicting more stacks. If unit's Strength is equal or higher than enemy's Strength, increases damage dealt based on unit's Strength.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that is effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses and inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared. After reaching its second stage it becomes effective against <icon>Monster</> Monsters too.
<icon>Anima</>: A tome that <icon>Drenched</> Drenches the enemy and that with each stage ignores a bigger % of enemy's resistance.
At 2nd stage it becomes effective against <icon>Infantry</> Infantry enemies and in its last stage it also becomes effective against Monsters and inflicts 3 stacks of <icon>Venom</> Venom.
<icon>Staff</>: A healing staff that heals HP equal to half of user's max HP. Buffs the ally after healing. With each stage, it can target one more ally.

name: Mogall
title: Mogall
text:
A mogall who seeks knowledge. His eyes are very perceptive.
Mogall's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Dark</><icon>Light</><icon>Staff</>
<icon>Dark</>: A 3 range tome that can't miss, double or do Dual Strikes. It reduces enemy's Avoid for 2 turns and heals damage dealt.
After reaching the second version, it can choose more than one target.
<icon>Light</>: A tome that raises Unit's Avoid and inflicts Reduced Vision.
<icon>Staff</>: A 1-3 range Support staff with a cooldown that buffs target's Hit and range with bows and magic. Its range increases with each version and on the last version, it can select two targets. It's a free action.

name: Gargoyle
title: Gargoyle
text:
A gentle gargoyle that desires to become beautiful and strong. She takes good care of her hair.
Gargoyle's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Lance</><icon>Sword</><icon>Anima</>
<icon>Lance</>: A reaver lance that uses Defense and Constitution, is effective against Armor enemies and inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures. In its last two stages, if it kills an enemy, it raises Def and Avoid.
<icon>Sword</>: A blade that inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures and <icon>Bleed</> Bleeding to the enemy. It has a cooldown.
<icon>Anima</>: A tome that is effective against <icon>Pirate</> Pirates. It inflicts <icon>Frozen</> Frozen and Petrify to the oponent. It has a cooldown. Always hits.

name: Bonewalker
title: Bonewalker
text:
A dark soul that refused to die. He seeks for a way to return to life.
Bonewalker's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Sword</><icon>Lance</><icon>Dark</><icon>Bow</>
<icon>Sword</>: A blade that inflicts <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight, Curse and reduces enemy's Mov for 3 turns. It targets Resistance.
After reaching its second version, it also uses Magic for damage and has a skill that makes units hit by this weapon more likely to target this unit. 
On its third version, it also raises Defense and in the last version, it also raises Resistance.
<icon>Lance</>: A lance that targets Resistance and inflicts <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight and Curse.
From its second stage onwards, it also uses Magic for damage. On its last stage, it has 1-2 range. If unit's Defense is higher or equal, enemy won't be able to counterattack.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that starts with 1 range, with its max range increasing with each version. It also inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures and has a Cleave effect.
<icon>Bow</>: A <icon>Light</> Light element bow that is effective against <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted enemies and uses Mag and Str. It gains the ability to heal adjacent allies after combat in later forms.

name: Tarvos
title: Tarvos
text:
The twisted result of monster experimentation. He fights to defend his supposed sister.
Tarvos' personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Axe</><icon>Bow</><icon>Light</><icon>Dark</>
<icon>Axe</>: A warhammer that is also effective against <icon>Armor</> Armor units. It inflicts Stun on the enemy and has the following effect:
When unit initiates combat, increases Damage and Crit based on unit's Mov. Also lowers enemy's Mov on hit for 2 turns.
<icon>Bow</>: A heavy bow that is effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses. After reaching the second stage, it also inflicts Breach and increases damage based on unit's Strength.
<icon>Light</>: A heavy tome with the following effect: Increases damage based on unit's Con. After killing an enemy with this tome, increases Strength and Con. Max 20 stacks of this buff.
<icon>Dark</>: A heavy tome that has the following effect: Enemies hit by this tome will be more likely to attack unit.
When defending, reduce damage taken based on unit's Con. From the second version onwards, enemies also have less Crit Avoid.

name: Tarvadour
title: Tarvadour
text:
The twisted result of monster experimentation. She finds purpose in healing others.

<icon>Staff</>: A healing staff that uses Magic and Mov for healing. It has a cooldown. It raises target's Mov and gives Canto+. In its last stage, it can target up to 3 units.

name: Gorgon
title: Gorgon
text:
A beautiful Gorgon recently hatched from an egg. She also has a beautiful singing voice.
Gorgon's personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Dark</><icon>Staff</><icon>Lance</><icon>Anima</>
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that increases Avoid based on Unit's Magic. On its second stage, it becomes effective against <icon>Magic</> Magic units.
<icon>Staff</>: A staff that is effective against <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblighted and <icon>Horse</> Horse units and inflicts <icon>Seared</> Seared on the enemy.
It starts with 1-4 range and it increases with each upgrade. It has a skill that reduces Avoid, Defense and Resistance for 2 turns.
<icon>Lance</>: A 2-3 range lance that inflicts <icon>Venom</> Venom and <icon>Drenched</> Drenches the enemy. It also uses Magic for damage. The stacks of Venom increase with each version.
It has a skill that increases Hit and Avoid when initiating combat and beginning from the second version it gives extra attacks.
<icon>Anima</>: A tome that is effective against <icon>Flying</> Flying and <icon>Seared</> Seared enemies.
It has a skill that increases Speed if unit kills an enemy with this tome. Gives extra attacks if unit's Attack Speed >= enemy's Attack Speed +5. Up to 10 stacks.

name: Cyclops
title: Cyclops
text:
A cyclops that is the last of his tribe. Doesn't like seeing his friends being hurt.
Cyclops' personal weapons.{br}<red>Proficiency: </><icon>Axe</><icon>Dark</><icon>Bow</>
<icon>Axe</>: A heavy axe that can inflict stun and uses Str x2 and eventually adds on Mag. 
Grants the Circle Swing skill which activates Galeforce when unit kills and enemy, but reduces STR by 75% for the rest of the turn. Works once per turn.
<icon>Dark</>: A tome that inflicts <icon>Shadowblight</> Shadowblight and <icon>Seared</> Seared. It is effective against <icon>Horse</> Horses, <icon>Flying</> Flying, and <icon>Seared</> Seared units.
Grants the Anger Fuel skill, which adds 1/2 unit's missing HP to damage, and adds unit's Max HP to Hit.
<icon>Bow</>: A heavy <icon>Earth</> Earth bow that is effective against <icon>Armor</> Armor and inflicts <icon>Rock</> Rock Punctures. Starts off with 2-3 range and increases to 5 range.
